Description: Sleeve of the end of red wool tunic (a) decorated with two applied tapestry panels (b & c); A broader piece (b) covers whole width of sleeve and a smaller strip (c) at the extremity of the sleeve; Tapered main seam of (a) now undone (folds to create tapering shape) applied with forcing strips of linen (d) sewn inside lower edges of seam; Main piece (a) was dyed after woven; Brushed nap well preserved beneath (b); Warp: weft-faced plain weave, S spun, c.11 tpc; Weft: S spun, c.27 tpc; Edges: starting border (2 cords perpendicular to plane of cloth, ending in knots), two selvedges (one and two selvedge cords), fourth edge ragged; Sewing: (b), (c), (d) sewn to (a) with undyed linen thread, S spun, Z ply, mainly overcasting with some running stitch, turned back edges of a0 sewn with red wool (S spun, Z ply, running stitch). (b) tapestry panel applied by sewing to the main sleeve; Multi-coloured wool and undyed linen; Design now incomplete but originally consisting of a central roundel flanked by double bands; Bands contain running animals (and an unidentified bottle shaped motif) with outer border of small flower buds; Warp: linen, S spun, Z ply, c.14 tpc; Weft: wool and linen, S spun, c.70 tpc; Edges: two plain selvedges, two cut edges turned under. (c) tapestry band applied by sewing to end of tunic sleeve; Design in pink, yellow and dark green wool and undyed linen on a dark blue ground; Abstract motifs derived from a repeating trellis design enclosing medallions; Tapestry on plied wool treads and some soumak outlining; Warp: linen, S spun, Z ply, c.12 tpc; Weft: wool and linen, S spun, c.46 tpc; Edges: two plain selvedges, two cut edges turned under. (d) two strips of linen sewn to inside of opening of tunic cuff; Undyed, plain weave apart from two groups of self-bands; Warp: S spun,c.19 tpc; Weft: S spun, c.14 tpc; Edges: all hidden; Little sign of wear.
Curator's comments: Previous location Cupboard 64, red box. Tunic is highly worn as indicated by difference in condition of (a) where uncovered and where originally covered by (b). Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (6.6.1990)
Condition: a) fair b) fragmentary but colours fair c) some holes d) good.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Maj William Joseph Myers (executors of)
